column1: Dynamic Explainable Recommendation Based on Neural Attentive Models
AAAI Technical Track: AI and the Web

Providing explanations in a recommender system is getting more and more attention in both industry and research communities. Most existing explainable recommender models regard user preferences as invariant to generate static explanations. However
column3: a user’s preference is always dynamic
column4: and she may be interested in different product features at different states. The mismatching between the explanation and user preference may degrade costumers’ satisfaction
column5: confidence and trust for the recommender system.
